subject: Public Speaking
title: The Rule of Three
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Rule of Three usable.

hook.text: Life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. Three items. Not two, not four. Three. There's a reason for that.

buildup.text: The human brain processes groups of three as a complete set. Two feels incomplete. Four feels like a list. Three works.

discovery.text: Comedians use it: setup, setup, punchline. Lawyers use it: three arguments. Speakers use it: three main points.

twist.text: The rule of three is so embedded that audiences get restless if you list two or four. Three satisfies a cognitive itch.

climax.text: It works because three is the smallest number creating a pattern. One is a statement. Two is comparison. Three is story.

punchline.text: Three points. Always three. Now you know why.

quiz.question: Why does the rule of three work in speeches?
options: The brain processes three items as a complete, satisfying pattern
